dialogue.raw_text: . LECTER (V.O.) Where were you going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I don't know. I had no food or water. It was very cold. I thought - if I can even save just one... but he got so heavy. So heavy...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I didn't get more than a few miles before the sheriff's car found me. The rancher was so angry he sent me to live at the Lutheran orphanage in Bozeman. I never saw the ranch again...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . LECTER (V.O.) But what became of your lamb? (no response) Clarice...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as the adult Clarice turns, staring into his feverish eyes. She shakes her head, unwilling - or unable - to say more.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . LECTER You still wake up sometimes, don't you? Wake up in the dark, with the lambs screaming?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . LECTER Do you think if you saved Catherine, you could make them stop...? Do you think, if Catherine lives, you won't wake up in the dark, ever again, to the screaming of the lambs? Do you...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes! I don't know...! I don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . LECTER (a pause; then, oddly at peace) Thank you, Clarice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a whisper) Tell me his name, Dr. Lecter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . LECTER Dr. Chilton... I believe you know each other?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as Clarice turns, startled, and the fuming Chilton seizes her elbow. Pembry and Boyle are beside him, looking grim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clarice struggles, pulling free of them for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He holds out the file, arm extended between the bars. She hesitates, then reaches to take it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Out. Let's go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry, ma'a m - we've got orders to have you put on a place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . LECTER Brave Clarice. Will you let me know if ever the lambs stop screaming?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (moving closer to the bars) Yes. I'll tell you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . LECTER Promise...? (she nods. He smiles) Then why not take your case file? I won't be needing it anymore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as the exchange is made, his index finger touches her hand, and lingers there, just for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LECTER'S EYES widen, crackling at this touch, like sparks in a cave.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . LECTER Good-bye, Clarice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: hugging the case file to her chest, stares back at him as the men crowd in on her, pushing her away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Dr. Lecter, head cocked in a smile, slowly recedes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ANGLE - MR. GUMB'S POV as he pushes a rolling rack of completed leather garments, each wrapped in plastic, down as aisle. SOUND of many sewing machines, all clattering at once, as he passes row on row of work tables. The seamstresses, mostly black or Hispanic, glance up as he passes, then quickly avert their eyes, his presence disturbing them in some nameless way. A thin FOREMAN in a flowery shirt, sees him approaching. He rises from his desk and comes over cheerfully, as the rack rolls to a stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He seizes one of the dangling jackets, pulling up the plastic wrapper. He examines it, stroking the sleeve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The foreman quickly releases the jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Gumb's hand reaches INTO SHOT, snatching an envelope from him. The foreman is watching him walk away, as a seamstress comes over to take the rack of garments. The foreman is vaguely troubled, but shakes it off. He strokes the jacket again, admiringly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, dear! Punctual as always. And what have you brought us today?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, marvelous... You know, I always say you're the Leonardo of leather.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . GUMB (O.S.) (a harsh whisper) Oil.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pardon...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . GUMB (O.S.) You're leaving oil on the skin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course... You'll be wanting your -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to seamstress) I wish we had a dozen like him...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - Glenn Gould playing Bach's Goldberg Variations...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clarice, in a line of other passengers, is moving slowly towards a departure ramp. Through a huge plate glass window, we can see her plane. She glances back over her shoulder at A pair of UNIFORMED COPS brawny and impassive, their arms folded, waiting to make sure she board the flight. Clarice sighs, turning wearily back towards the jetway. The BACH CONTINUES, as we...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COURTHOUSE - HISTORICAL SOCIETY ROOM -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON a steaming, rather elegant dinner tray, being carried by Pembry, as he approaches Dr. Lecter's cell.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (shouts) Ready when you are, Doc!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: the BACH is issuing from the cassette player. Beside it, on the table, the pile of Dr. Lecter's drawings. The top one is an accurate, sensitive portrait, from memory, of Clarice. Beyond the table, we see Lecter's shadowy form, seated behind the paper screen. He calls out from there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pembry grunts, sets the tray down. Boyle joins him, handing him a riot baton and a Mace cannister, which Pembry fastens to belt clips. Boyle is similarly armed, and carries a ring of keys.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . LECTER (O.S.) Just another minute, please!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sumbitch demanded lamb chops for dinner, extra rare.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughs) What you reckon he'll want for breakfast - some fuckin' thing from the zoo?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Dr. Lecter sits fully clothed on the toilet - swaying slightly, eyes closed, lost in the music, tongue working in his cheek. Suddenly, like magic, a little shiny piece of metal protrudes from his lips. He plucks it out, opens his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: he is holding the pocket clip from Prentice's disassembled pen - a straight, thin strip of metal, with a circular collar at one end, a square edge at the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LECTER lines up his thumbnail just shy of the square edge, then braces it against the stainless steel toilet rim. He pushes down, hard, using both hands for leverage. After a moment he smiles, holding up the result, and twirling it before his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the straight end of the clip now forms a tiny right angle, and the circular end anchors nicely between his fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pembry and Boyle turn as the toilet FLUSHES, and Dr. Lecter reappears, looking jaunty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Lecter sits on the floor, legs straight, then wriggles backwards. He stretches his arms behind him, hands and wrists through the bars, with two bars between them, and clasps his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pembry comes around the cell to squat behind Dr. Lecter. He tugs his hands farther out, rather roughly, handcuffs his wrists. He shakes the cuffs, making sure of them, then nods to Boyle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, Doc, grab some floor. Same drill as lunchtime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . LECTER I'm ready when you are, Officer Pembry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as Boyle picks up the dinner tray, and Pembry crosses around. Pembry takes the keys from Boyle, unlocks the cell door, and pushes it inward. Boyle goes inside with the tray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LECTER watches as Boyle approaches the table, above five feet from him. Boyle has to set his tray down on the floor to clear off some of the mess of drawings. The MUSIC plays on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON ...Dr. Lecter's hands, outside the bars, as the makeshift key, held between the tips of his right index and middle fingers, searches for the keyhole of the cuffs. And finds it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he finishes clearing the drawings, then turns back towards Dr. Lecter, stooping to pick up the tray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is just inches from the tray when Dr. Lecter's hand darts INTO SHOT, snapping a handcuff onto his wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks up, astonished, to find himself right in the grinning face of Dr. Lecter - who just as quickly rolls sideways, and snaps -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: around the bolted leg of the table. And suddenly all natural SOUND and MOTION are suspended, as the MUSIC soars much louder, each separate note of it now echoing distinctly, and we see...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S - EACH BLURRING INTO STOP-ACTION Pembry starting into the cell, reaching for his riot baton... Dr. Lecter smashing against the cell door, driving it into Pembry, pinning him across the chest, against the door frame... Boyle, on one knee on the floor, digging desperately in his pants pocket for his handcuff key... Pembry's hand, mashed against his body by the door, as he strains frantically to reach the baton at his waist... Pembry's eyes, widening in horror as he stares at... Dr. Lecter's bared teeth, flashing towards him... Dr. Lecter gripping Pembry's face in his jaws, shaking it like a dog shakes a rat... Boyle finding his key, but in his terror dropping it... Dr. Lecter yanking the mace can and riot baton from the dazed Pembry's belt, spraying him in his bloody face, then clubbing him to his knees... Boyle, mouth open in a silent scream, finding his key again, unlocking the handcuff, but then, as he starts to rise, seeing... Dr. Lecter standing over him, with the riot baton raised high; he swings it viciously down, again and again and again... Then normal SOUND and MOTION are restored as we go to -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON the cassette player, and the portrait of Clarice, both now flecked with blood. In addition to the Bach, we now hear soft PANTING, close by, and whimpering SOBS in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LECTER eyes closed, lost in a favorite passage of the music. His bloody fingers drift airily with the notes, as his breathing slows to normal. He opens his eyes, sighs contentedly, looks down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the sprawled legs of Boyle lie various objects that spilled from his pants pocket - coins, a comb, a big pocketknife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LECTER picks up the pocketknife, examines it happily. About a four- inch blade. He becomes aware of the WHIMPERING, off screen, turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he crawls, with torturous slowness, towards the command desk, and the phone. He is crying, but frantically determined.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Above the desk, hanging from pegs, are his and Boyle's holstered revolvers...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bronze arrow above the elevator swings towards "5," then indicates a stop there, at the top floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TATE at his command desk, as he stares at the indicator. Another cop, JACOBS, sits on the desk's edge, flipping through a magazine; many more cops can be seen beyond them, idling in the lobby.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . TATE What is this shit...? Did somebody go up to five? (Jacobs shakes his head) Call Pembry, ask him what -
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and then, moments later, TWO MORE quick ones, echo down the nearby stairwell. Sgt. Tate jumps to his feet, grabs a radio mike, as the other cops stir, confused and noisy.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . TATE (into mike)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: shots fired on five! Repeat, shots fires on five! Outside posts look sharp, we've got a... Ho-ly shit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: has begun to descend. Down to 4, then past 4...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TATE as he reacts. The other cops, behind him, are now in a full uproar, shouting, pulling out guns.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . TATE (to the others)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...! Guard mount, double up on your outside posts. Bobby, get the vests. Rainey, Howard, cover that fucking elevator if it comes all the way to -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) It stopped!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: has, indeed, frozen at 3. Sgt. Tate lifts the microphone again.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . TATE (into mike) Seal off a ten-block radius. Get me the SWAT team and an ambulance, double quick. We're going up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: on Sgt. Tate as he leads a five-man squad, all in bulletproof vests, up the stone stairs. They move fast but carefully, covering each other from landing to landing with drawn revolvers, shotguns. The distant Back MUSIC makes a ghostly echo in here...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A thin rectangle of light on the floor from the open elevator door. We can't see inside. The MUSIC sounds closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TATE approaches very cautiously, gun aimed. The other cops, behind him, fan out silently to set up angles of fire, checking the various office doors - all locked - as they creep up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ANGLE - OVER TATE'S SHOULDER as he reaches the side of the elevator, hesitates, then spins to point his gun inside. It's empty. He backs away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . TATE (shouts at ceiling) Pembry? Boyle...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: on the door, from inside, its lettering reversed on the frosted glass. The Bach is VERY LOUD. After a moment the door is shouldered open, hard enough for the glass to shatter, Tate following his gun inside, moving low, then other cops appearing behind him in the doorframe. They all freeze, staring in utter horror.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . TATE Oh no... no...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is a brief snapshot from hell. The two uniformed bodies, one sprawled on its back near the door, the other still in the cell, have been savaged by a knife. Blood and gore everywhere. The faces are unrecognizable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TATE struggles for control, as the other cops move grimly around him, into the room. He pulls his walkie-talkie from his belt.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . TATE (into mike) Command post... Two offi- (a beat; clears his throat) Two officers down. Prisoner is missing. Repeat, Lecter is missing... He's stripped the bed, might be making a rope, check all windows. Where the fuck is my ambulance?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: a cop angrily punches OFF the music. Jacobs kneels with his fingers on Boyle's neck.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Boyle is dead, Sarge. His gun's gone...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: a cop gently removes a revolver from the bloody fist. Murray, the young patrolman, brings his ear reluctantly close to the gory face. A bloody bubble appears there; the wreckage GROANS, very softly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tate crosses, kneels to see for himself. Murray looks green.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The other cop, checking the cylinder of Pembry's gun, holds up one finger to Tate.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This one's alive!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . TATE Take ahold of him where he can feel your hands, son. Talk to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's his name, Sarge?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . TATE It's Pembry, now talk to him, God dammit. (into radio, looking around) Boyle's dead, Pembry's read bad. Lecter is missing and armed - he took Boyle's gun...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . TATE (into radio) Pembry got off one round - there's a chance Lecter was hit. We heard a total of three shots fired, so he's got four left... He's got a knife, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: S on a floodlit scene of barely controlled pandemonium. Flashing red lights, men shouting commands, SIRENS in the distance. SWAT members, in full gear, leap from a black van... fan out... swarm up the steps... EMS orderlies unload a gurney from an ambulance... Cops kneel for cover behind cars, aiming guns and rifles up at the windows...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A trio of EMS orderlies work fast over the body, already strapped on its gurney. They bandage a big plastic airway into place, over the butchered face, checking for a pulse at the neck. Young Murray crouches, sickened, gripping a bloody fist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One orderly massages the heart. Another is popping a plasma bag, ready to insert the needle, when the body starts convulsing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quickly the gurney is elevated, wheeled out of the room, with cops rushing forward to open the doors, help push, SWAT men are running by in the hall, automatic rifles at the ready...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You're just fine, Pembry, lookin' good, buddy, you're gonna make it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Downstairs - let's go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sgt. Tate, riding down with Jacobs, has his radio out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A spot of blood falls on his cheek. He and Jacobs stare at each other. Another spot hits his shoulder. They look up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . TATE (into mike) Ten-four, Lieutenant. I'm on the elevator, bringing it down. Pembry and Boyle are both cleared, top three floors secured, main stairwell secured. He's somewhere on -
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Blood is dripping slowly from the corner of the service hatch. Sgt. Tate motions for silence, as both men draw their guns.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . TATE (into mike) Uh, we're pretty sure he's somewhere on two, sir... That's all for now, over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The elevator doors open, and Tate and Jacobs hurry out, stepping quickly to the side. Tate reaches back in and -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Locks the elevator into position, with its doors open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: are rushing up to them, curious, as Tate frantically pushes them aside, gesturing for silence.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . TATE (whispers) He's on the roof of the elevator!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Two SWAT officers, PETERSON and KUBELL, turn a key, unlocking and opening this floor's elevator doorway. The shaft is dark. Lying prone, they inch up to the edge, Peterson extends a mirror, on a long pole, out into the shaft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is a distant figure, in a green prison jumpsuit, lying on his stomach, atop the elevator. A shiny revolver is near one hand.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: IN THE MIRROR, (DISTORTED BY THE ANGLE)

direction.raw_text: whispers into a radio, as Kubell carefully tips an assault rifle, with a flashlight taped to its barrel, over the edge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peterson nods to Kubell, who switches ON the flashlight, as Peterson shouts down the shaft.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I see him... There's a weapon by his hand. He's not moving...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can you get the drop?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We got the drop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One warning. Then take him out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Quinn!! put your hands on your head!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: the green figure shows no movement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Peterson mutters to Kubell.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Put one in his leg.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ON The figure below, as Kubell's gunshot ROARS, echoing hugely in the shaft, and a slug rips through the jumpsuited leg. The figure doesn't stir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: staring down the shaft, raises his mike again.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No movement.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, Johnny, hold your fire...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A small army of cops is now covering the elevator doorway, from both sides. Tate crouches next to the SWAT COMMANDER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SWAT commander hands his radio to another cop, then looks at Tate. A long, tense moment. Then he waves a signal.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into radio mike) We're coming into the car, we're opening the hatch. Watch his hands. Any fire will come from us. Affirm?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Got it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ANGLE as we follow a picked team of four SWAT cops, in full body armor, rushing into the elevator car. Two men move to the corners, aim assault rifles at the ceiling. A third man sets a stepladder in place, and the fourth man, armed with a big Colt, hurries up the ladder and unclips the hatch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON ...the service hatch, as the hinged cover drops open, and a body tumbles through, dangling head first, until it's caught at the waist. We see the back of the head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TATE shoulders through the SWAT cops for a closer look. He turns towards the SWAT commander, astonished.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . TATE That's Pembry!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In the rear chamber, a young EMS ATTENDANT is braced against the vehicle's sway. Behind him, the stretchered form of his patient, and, through a curtained opening, the driver. SOUND of the siren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind him, in slightly BLURRED FOCUS, the bloody figure sits slowly upright...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly he stops, becoming aware of a strange HISSING. He turns, puzzled...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into radio mike) He's comatose, but his vital signs are good. Pressure's 130 over 90... Yeah, 90! Pulse 85...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: His convulsions have stopped, but he's got so much loose skin on his face, it's hard to tell if -
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: in Lecter's fist, flashes high in the air...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ANGLE on the EMS ambulance, as it races along normally, its SIREN blazing, the heavy flow of traffic parting to make way for it. Then suddenly it begins to weave erratically, changing lanes, before drifting dangerously to a full stop, almost side-ways. Cars swerve to avoid hitting it, HONKING angrily...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE on the stopped ambulance. After a long, still moment, the wind-shield wipes come on, incongruously, then stop. Then the SIREN is shut OFF, and the flashers. The ambulance starts rolling again - at first jerkingly, then with increasing speed. We follow it for several more moments, until is passes - and we LINGER on...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...that reads "Memphis International Airport / 2 miles."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Lecter's face is slowly REVEALED, as he wipes across it with a fistful of gauze, tossing it aside...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DUSK - (IN FLASHBACK)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ANGLE, rushing with dizzy swiftness over the prairie, over waving grasses... a long passage... before we come at last to the girl Clarice, sitting with her lamb, hunched in despair. She rises, her face tear-stained, and turns from us. Holding the lamb, she starts back the way she came...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - BRIGHT MOONLIGHT MOVING ANGLE, very rapid, down this road... coming at last to a stopped highway patrol car. Clarice, with her lamb, is standing in the car's headlights. She starts wearily towards the sheriff...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ANGLE - sweeping rapidly DOWN into the barnyard towards the arriving highway patrol car, as it stops... RUSHING to the little girl as she steps from the car, holding the lamb. The dark figure of the rancher ENTERS FRAME. As he roughly takes the lamb from her, we HOLD on a CLOSEUP of her face - stunned, blank. She EXITS FRAME...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ANGLE - CLARICE'S POV as she walks towards the open barn doorway... It looms CLOSER... The rancher is revealed, a shadowy figure, pinning the lamb on the killing table. His knife hand sweeps up high, then holds... He turns TO CAMERA, his face breaking into the light - and it is the face of Dr. Lecter. He smiles his terrible smile at the young Clarice...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ANGLE - coming in very CLOSE on the adult Clarice's face - shocked, devastated - as she stands alone by the dangling receiver...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON a shower head, as water suddenly blasts out. Clarice moves INTO SHOT, as she scrubs her face and hair compulsively, almost desperately, unable to get clean...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) They found the ambulance...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Clarice is hunched on her cot, in a bathrobe, her hair wet. The Buffalo Bill case file, a thick bundle, rests by her feet. Ardelia hovers anxiously nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clarice looks up. Her eyes are red-rimmed with exhaustion, and something close to despair. She reads Ardelia's thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ardelia sits beside her, touches her arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ardelia stares back at her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: In the parking garage at Memphis airport. The crew was dead. He killed a tourist, too. Got his clothes, cash... By now he could be anywhere.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. He won't come after me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (bitterly) It would be rude. And he wouldn't get to ask any more questions...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Clarice - you did the best anybody could have for Catherine Martin. You stuck your neck out for her and you got your butt kicked for her and you tried. It's not your fault it ended this way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The worst part - the thing that's making me crazy - is that Bill is right in front of me. Only I can't see him... (touching the case file) Lecter said, everything I need to catch him is right here, in these pages...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lecter said a lot of things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shakes her head) He's here, Ardelia.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - the low throb of a washing machine...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clarice has spread out the case file across two washing machines. Ardelia, cross-legged on a dryer, studies another pile of forms. Nearby is their laundry basket, detergent box.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (surprised) Hey, is this Lecter's handwriting? She holds up the map, with its location markings for the kidnapping and body dump sites. Clarice takes it, looks.

direction.raw_text: . GUMB'S WORKROOM - DAY (GREEN LIGHT) Clarice emerges from the bathroom in a half-crouch, arms out, both hands on the gun, extended just below the level of her unseeing eyes. She stops, listens. In her raw-nerved darkness, every SOUND is unnaturally magnified - the HUM of the refrigerator... the TRICKLE of water... her own terrified BREATHING, and Catherine's faraway, echoing SOBS... Moths smack against her face and arms. She eases forward, then stops again, listens... She eases forward again, following her gun, and creeps directly in front of, and then past -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GUMB who has flattened himself against a wall, arms spread like a high priest, Colt in one hand. He wears his goggles and kimono, and under that - draping down over his naked arms, like some hideous mantle - his terrifying, half-completed suit of human skins. This is an exquisite moment for him - a ritual of supreme exaltation. He smiles at Clarice as, completely unaware, she moves beyond him, exposing her back. Very slowly and quietly he steps out behind her, taking his gun in both hands, aiming...

direction.raw_text: ANGLE - WITH CLARICE as she crawls forward, on her elbows, following her gun, until it bumps against Mr. Gumb's shoulder. He is lying on his back, chest a bloody mess. She slides her muzzle against his head, hard, but he doesn't move; another shot isn't needed. He stares upwards, through his goggles, bloody lips working. He tries to speak, but cannot. One hand reaches slowly upwards, the fingers twitching, as if to seize something, overhead... Then a final, ghastly groan, his hand drops, he is dead. Clarice feels for a pulse at his neck, making sure. Then, and only then, does she permit herself to roll over, collapsing onto her back beside him.

Cars and vans and even a firetruck choke the street; cops, reporters, EMS workers and curious civilians swarm around the ineffective barricades. The BUZZ of their voices goes even higher as

direction.raw_text: dazed, her face bandaged - comes out of the house, walking protectively beside Catherine, who is wheeled on a gurney. They are followed out by uniformed cops, then two firemen with an extension ladder. Catherine, blinking in confusion, is still clutching the little dog, and refuses to give her up even as she's trundled into an ambulance. Clarice sways with exhaustion; everyone seems to be shouting at her at once, pulling her sleeve. She tries to fight free of them, desperate for a familiar face.
